title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 210-4.1 - In-use testing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 210-4.1 - In-use testing

State Regulations
(a) All
manufacturers of personal watercraft engines subject to this Part, certified
for sale in California and produced and delivered for sale in New York shall
conduct in-use testing as required by California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2444.1
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). The
department shall accept the emissions data collected in accordance with

California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2444.1(b)
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (b) The department, upon notice to the engine
manufacturers, may prescribe that a New York specific in-use testing program be
conducted in accordance with California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2444.l(b) (see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (c) Manufacturers shall submit to the
department, upon request, records from the in-use testing program, in
accordance with California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2444.l(c)
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title), within three
months of completion of the in-use testing program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
210-4.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
